open_questions.title: Azure and why is it important
open_questions.description: What is Azure and why is it important?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is Azure and why is it important?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure is a cloud computing platform and service provided by Microsoft. It offers a wide range of cloud services, including virtual machines, databases, AI and machine learning tools, and more. Azure is important because it enables organizations to scale and manage their infrastructure, reduce costs, and accelerate development and deployment of applications.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The difference between Azure Virtual Machines
open_questions.description: What is the difference between Azure Virtual Machines (VMs) and Azure App Service?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the difference between Azure Virtual Machines (VMs) and Azure App Service?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Virtual Machines provide more control over the underlying infrastructure and allow you to run a wider range of software, while Azure App Service is a platform-as-a-service (PaaS) offering that simplifies application deployment and management. App Service is ideal for web and mobile applications, while VMs are more versatile.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The concept of Azure Resource Groups.
open_questions.description: Explain the concept of Azure Resource Groups.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "Explain the concept of Azure Resource Groups.?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Resource Groups are logical containers that allow you to organize and manage related Azure resources. Resources within a group can be deployed, updated, or deleted together. They are a way to manage and monitor resources as a single entity, aiding in resource management and access control.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The difference between Azure SQL Database
open_questions.description: Explain the difference between Azure SQL Database and Azure Cosmos DB.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "Explain the difference between Azure SQL Database and Azure Cosmos DB.?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure SQL Database is a relational database service in the cloud that is based on Microsoft SQL Server. It's designed for structured data and supports traditional relational database models. Azure Cosmos DB, on the other hand, is a globally distributed, multi-model database service that can handle both structured and unstructured data. It's suitable for NoSQL workloads and scenarios requiring high availability and low-latency access worldwide.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: Azure DevOps and how can it
open_questions.description: What is Azure DevOps and how can it be used in the software development lifecycle?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is Azure DevOps and how can it be used in the software development lifecycle?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure DevOps is a set of development tools and services that facilitate collaboration and automation throughout the software development lifecycle (SDLC). It includes features for version control, continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD), project management, and testing. Teams can use Azure DevOps to plan, build, test, and deploy applications efficiently.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The differences between Azure Functions and
open_questions.description: Explain the differences between Azure Functions and Azure Logic Apps.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "Explain the differences between Azure Functions and Azure Logic Apps.?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Functions are event-driven, serverless compute services that allow you to run code in response to events or triggers. Azure Logic Apps are workflow automation services that enable you to build and orchestrate workflows that integrate with various services and systems. Functions are primarily focused on code execution, while Logic Apps are focused on business process automation.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: Azure Availability Zones, and how do
open_questions.description: What are Azure Availability Zones, and how do they contribute to high availability?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What are Azure Availability Zones, and how do they contribute to high availability?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Availability Zones are physically separate datacenters within an Azure region. They provide redundancy and fault tolerance for applications and services by ensuring that if one zone becomes unavailable, the others continue to operate. Using Availability Zones helps achieve higher availability and resilience for critical workloads.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: How Azure Virtual Network (VNet) peering
open_questions.description: Explain how Azure Virtual Network (VNet) peering works.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "Explain how Azure Virtual Network (VNet) peering works.?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure VNet peering allows you to connect virtual networks in the same region or across regions. It enables seamless communication between resources in peered VNets as if they were in the same network. Traffic between peered VNets is secure and doesn't traverse the public internet, making it ideal for creating complex network topologies.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Managed Identity is an identity service that simplifies authentication for applications and services running in Azure. Service Principal, on the other hand, is an identity created for use with applications, service accounts, or automation tools. Managed Identity is recommended for most scenarios, while Service Principal is more suitable when applications need access to resources in other Azure tenants or non-Azure services.

open_questions.title: The difference between Azure Load Balancer
open_questions.description: Explain the difference between Azure Load Balancer and Azure Application Gateway.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "Explain the difference between Azure Load Balancer and Azure Application Gateway.?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Load Balancer is a Layer 4 (TCP/UDP) load balancer that distributes network traffic among multiple virtual machines. Azure Application Gateway is a Layer 7 (HTTP/HTTPS) load balancer that operates at the application level and provides features like SSL termination and web application firewall (WAF). Choose Load Balancer for generic TCP/UDP load balancing and Application Gateway for advanced application-level routing and security features.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) is a managed container orchestration service that simplifies the deployment, management, and scaling of containerized applications using Kubernetes. It's beneficial because it abstracts away the complexities of managing the Kubernetes control plane and allows developers to focus on building and deploying applications.

open_questions.title: The concept of Azure Functions triggers
open_questions.description: Explain the concept of Azure Functions triggers and bindings.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "Explain the concept of Azure Functions triggers and bindings.?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Functions triggers are events or sources that initiate the execution of a serverless function, while bindings define the input and output connections to other services or data sources. For example, a trigger could be an HTTP request, and a binding could be connecting to an Azure Storage Queue to read and write messages. This allows you to build event-driven, serverless workflows.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: Azure Traffic Manager, and how does
open_questions.description: What is Azure Traffic Manager, and how does it improve the availability and performance of applications?

open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Traffic Manager is a global DNS-based traffic load balancer that directs user traffic to specific Azure services or endpoints in different geographic regions. It improves availability and performance by routing traffic to the nearest or healthiest endpoint, ensuring minimal downtime and optimal user experience.

open_questions.title: The purpose of Azure Resource Locks

open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Resource Locks are used to prevent accidental deletion or modification of Azure resources. They can be applied at the resource group or resource level. Use CanNotDelete locks to prevent resource deletion and ReadOnly locks to prevent modifications. They are helpful when you want to ensure critical resources are protected from inadvertent changes.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Virtual WAN is a networking service that simplifies and optimizes branch-to-branch and branch-to-Azure connectivity. referenceAnswers.text: Azure Front Door is a global content delivery and application acceleration service. open_questions.title: The concept of Azure Blue-Green Deployment.
open_questions.description: Explain the concept of Azure Blue-Green Deployment.?

open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Blue-Green Deployment is a deployment strategy that involves maintaining two identical environments (blue and green) where one is actively serving production traffic, and the other is a clone for testing and deployment of new versions. It minimizes downtime and risk during updates by switching traffic from the old (blue) environment to the new (green) environment once testing is successful.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: Azure Blob Storage, Azure File Storage,
open_questions.description: Explain Azure Blob Storage, Azure File Storage, and Azure Disk Storage.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "Explain Azure Blob Storage, Azure File Storage, and Azure Disk Storage.?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Azure Blob Storage: Blob Storage is used to store unstructured data like documents, images, videos, and backups. It's suitable for scenarios where you need scalable and cost-effective storage for large volumes of data. Azure File Storage: File Storage provides SMB file shares that can be accessed by multiple virtual machines. It's ideal for shared storage in Windows environments and application data that needs file-based access. Azure Disk Storage: Disk Storage is used for attaching persistent disks to virtual machines. It's best for scenarios where you need high-performance block storage, such as running databases.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice
